column3:
あたしらはどっちにしろあまり関わりたく
ない場所だけど、あんたにとっては
禁域にいく理由があるかもしれないだろ
column4: We don't really want to get involved either way, but there might be a reason for you to go to the Forbidden Zone.

column3: もしそうなら、行ってみるといいよ
column4: If so, it's a good idea to go and check it out.

column3:
ちょっとちょっと、大変だよ！
東の地下道前なんだけど、またいつの間にか
オーク共がイヌの訓練を始めたみたいなんだ
column4:
Hey, hey, it's a big deal!
In front of the East Underground Passage, somehow, once again it looks like the Orcs have started training their dogs!

column3: せっかく居なくなったと思ってたのにさ！
column4: I thought they were gone for good!

column3:
やつら、この村や南の平原に攻め込むのに
イヌ共を使う気に違いないさね
column4: Those guys, they must be planning to use dogs to invade this village and the southern plains.

column3:
なんとか手を打てればいいんだけど――
あんた《魔犬養育所》、何とかできないかい？
column4:
I wish I could do something about it--
Can't you do something about it, the 《Demon Dog Kennel》?

column3:
あんたに一つお知らせがあるよ！
フロックヴァルト大橋近くの
《テゴル治水路》なんだけどさ
column4: I have a piece of news for you! It's about the "Tegor Floodway" near Flocwald Bridge.

column3:
あそこは、ガルドノック砦がオークに占領
された当時に、騎士団が封鎖した場所だったのよ
column4: At that time, Gardnox Fortress was occupied by Orcs, and it was the place that the Knight Order blocked.

column3:
それを引き継いで封鎖してきた
わけなんだけど、
古くても使える遺物があれば
活用したほうがいいじゃない？
column4: To take over and block it, wouldn't it be better to make use of any ancient relics that are still functional?

column3:
私らには危ないけど
あんたには役立つものもあるかも
しれないから、開けておいたよ
column4: It's not safe for us, but some of it might be useful for you so I opened it.

column3: 暇なら一度、覗いてみなよ！
column4: If you have free time, please take a look!

column3:
あぁ、どうしようかねぇ！
困ったことになったんだよ
column4:
Oh, I don't know what to do!
I'm in trouble.

column3:
ガルドノックから村に続く道の途中のさ
《ガルドノック哨戒地》なんだけど――
column4: From Gardnox Patrol Area, along the road leading to the village...

column3:
そこにすっごい大っきな牙のドラゴンが
出たってのよ！
column4: There, a dragon with huge fangs appeared!

column3:
どうしよう、ついにドラワンも終わりなのかねぇ
ああいやだいやだ――
column4:
I don't know, I wonder if this is finally the end of Drawan.
Oh no, no, no--

column3:
誰か――、そうだ、あんただ！
あんた、なんとかしておくれよ！
後生さね！
column4:
Somebody--yes, you!
You've got to do something!
For God's sake!

column3:
もうさ、あんたがさ、ドラワンのために――
ここまで尽くしてくれて――
顔見たら涙が滲んじまったよ
column4:
You know, you've done so much for Drawan--
I couldn't help but tear up when I saw your face...

column3:
ううぅっ、私には大それたことできないけどさ
ちょっとでもあんたの役に立てるなら――
column4: Ugh, I can't do much, but if I can be of any help to you at all--

column3: ぐずっ！　あらやだ鼻が――
column4: *Sniff*! Oh no, my nose—

column3:
ねぇねぇ、この辺りにある《辺境の礎》が
ぜ～んぶ使えるようになったんだって！
あんたの移動も楽になるよ、きっと！
column4: Hey hey, I heard that all the "Sub Portcrystals" around this area are now available for use! Your movement will definitely become easier, I'm sure!

column3:
こっちにまで礎を作ってくれるってことは
神殿もバートランド北部のこと
見捨てたわけじゃなかったんだね――
column4: The fact that they're even building a Portcrystal over heremeans that the Temple didn't abandon the northern part of Betland--.

column3:
ぐすっ
ああいやだよ、涙腺がゆるんじまって――
column4:
*Sob*
Oh no, I'm tearing up....

column3:
そうだ、これはあんたに相談しといた方が
良さそうな話なんだけどさ
column4: Yeah, I should probably talk to you about this

column3:
最近、ガルドノック砦の方が
何だか騒がしいんだよ
オークたちがやけに出たり入ったりしてるしね
column4: Lately, Gardnox Fortress has been quite noisy. The Orcs seem to be going in and out quite a bit.

column3:
もしも中でよからぬことが起こってたら
このドラワンだけじゃなく
グリッテンも危ないかも知れないよ
column4: If something inappropriate were happening inside, not only Drawan, but Gritten might also be in danger, you know.

column3:
あんたさえ良ければ
一度中を見て来てもらえると安心なんだけど――
column4: If you don't mind, I'd feel a lot safer if you came by once to take a look inside--

column3:
あ、中を見てきてくれるっていうなら
あたしに一声かけてから行ってね！
分かってること全部教えてあげるから！
column4:
Ah, if you're going to look inside, let me know first!
I'll tell you everything I know!

column3:
ちょうどよかったよ！
あんたに伝えておきたいことがあるんだ！
column4:
That's great!
I have something to tell you!

column3:
この前見てきてもらったガルドノック砦に
侵食されたオークがいただろ？
それを調査したいって騎士団の人たちが来てさ
column4: You know the Orcs that had invaded Gardnox Fortress that I showed you the other day? Some members of the knight order came to investigate it.

column3:
その騎士さんたちがガルドノック砦の奥にある
《ガルドノック廃水廊》ってところを調べたら
もう侵食が進んで大変なことになってたらしいよ
column4: It seems that those knights have investigated the Gardnox Sewers deep within Gardnox Fortress, and it appears that the corruption has advanced and become quite severe.

column3:
入口は多分騎士さんが開けたままになってるから
あんたも気になるなら見てくればいいよ
column4:
The entrance is probably still open because the Knight didn't close it.
If you're curious, you can take a look.

column3:
なんか調べてるんだろ？
あの侵食魔ってやつのこと
column4:
I wonder if you're looking up something?
About that thing called the Corruption Magic.

column3:
ああ、あんたかい
ちょっと聞いておくれよ
column4:
Ah, is it you?
Hey, could you listen for a moment?

column3:
何日か前さ、村の近くで
気持ちの悪い魔物を見たんだよ――
少なくともあたしはあんなの見たの初めてだよ
column4: A few days ago, I saw a creepy enemy near the village, you know. It's the first time I've ever seen something like that.

column3:
怒った男の顔がついたような魔物でね
目も赤く光ってたんだ！
column4: It was a monster with a face that looked like an angry man. Its eyes were also shining red!

column3:
――そこでお願いなんだけど、
《ガルドノック廃水廊》に
そいつが棲みついてないか
確認してきてほしいんだよ
column4:
-- So, I have a favor to ask.
Could you please go and check if it is residing in the "Gardnox Sewers"?
I would really appreciate it.

column3:
行ってくれるなら、くわしく説明するよ
あたしに声かけてね
column4:
If you go, I'll explain in detail.
Please contact me.

column3:
ううっ、いつもありがとね、ホント――
迷惑ばっかりかけてるっていうのに
こんな小さな村に変わらず立ち寄ってくれて――
column4:
Oh, thank you so much, really――
Despite causing nothing but trouble, you still stop by this small village unchanged――

column3:
問題を解決してくれるってことも嬉しいんだけどさ
あんたがさ、ここまでドラワンのことを
気にかけてくれるってこと自体が嬉しくて――
column4: I'm also happy that you solve problems for me, but what makes me truly glad is that you cared so much about Drawan until now.

column3:
あたしたちもあんたの役に立ちたいんだ
何にもない村だけど、精一杯あんたを支援させてよ
column4:
We also want to be of help to you. 
Though it's just a small village with nothing much, we will do our best to support you.

column3:
ぐずっ！
えへへ、目が赤くなっちゃったよ
みっともなくてごめんね
column4:
Oops!
Oh dear, my eyes have turned red.
I'm sorry for being so embarrassing.

column3: ――取引か？
column4: ――A Mere Transaction?

column3: 今ある品が全部だ
column4: This is all the items we currently have.

column3: 気に入るものはないか？
column4: See something you like?

column3: ――何か、買って行け
column4: ――Buy something and take it with you.

column3: おお、俺に用か？
column4: Oh, you wanted to see me?

column3:
こんな辺境によく来たな
魔物に食われないよう注意しろよ
column4:
I'm surprised you came to this remote area.
Be careful the demons don't eat you.

column3:
オーク共が根城を近くに構えてから
村人の半分は、ずっと昔に別の地方へ移った
column4: Since the orcs set up their stronghold nearby, half of the villagers have moved to another region a long time ago.

column3:
今残ってるのは諦め悪い連中の家系だが
そうこうしてるうち、砦と関所で隔てられて
ここに残らざるを得なくなったってとこだ
column4:
The only ones left are the stubborn descendants who refuse to give up. 
As time went on, we became separated by forts and checkpoints. 
And this is where we ended up, unable to leave.

column3: 俺もまぁ、そのクチだな
column4: I guess I'm that kind of person too.

column3:
オークに攫われた人間がどうなるか
考えたくもない――
column4: I don't even want to think about what happens to people kidnapped by orcs--

column3:
それを諦めきれないのが、俺がここにいる
理由だな――
column4: I can't give that up, which is why I'm here--

column3:
――このドラワンに残ってる者は
何かに囚われて動くことができない
者なのだろう
column4: Those who remain in Drawan are probably unable to move, as if they are trapped by something.

column3:
俺と同じような理由で囚われていた奴――
オークに攫われた恋人を追って奴らのアジト
《ガルドノック砦》へ潜入を試みた奴がいてな
column4:
There was someone who, for the same reason as me, was being held captive—
They attempted to infiltrate the hideout of the orcs, Gardnox Fortress, to rescue their kidnapped lover.

column3:
かなりのやり手だった
オークの部隊長を一人で倒し
砦の見取り図を手に入れたそうだ
俺から見てもすごい執念だったよ
column4:
He was quite a capable person. 
He single-handedly defeated the Orc captain and obtained a map of the fortress. 
It was an incredible determination even from my perspective.

column3:
あいつはどうなったのかな――
無事に恋人を助け出せたのなら
今頃は別の町にでも移っているのだろうが
column4:
I wonder what happened to that person--
If they were able to safely rescue their lover, They might have already moved to another town by now.

column3: まぁ、こんな村へようこそ
column4: Well, welcome to such a village!

column3:
家畜は私達の生命線なんです
ただでさえ土地が荒れてるっていうのに
これ以上、魔物に持っていかれたら――
column4:
Livestock is our lifeline.
The land is already barren, and if we lose any more to the enemy...

column3: 毎日、憂鬱なことばかりです
column4: Every day, it's nothing but depressing things.

column3:
北の地は昔から《禁じられた地》と呼ばれて
近づく人はいませんでした
column4: For centuries, the northern land has been known as the "Forbidden Land," with no one daring to come near.

column3:
オークもですが、ここは白竜様の加護のない
忌まわしい地なのです
column4: Orcs too, but this is an abominable place without the Divine Protection of The White Dragon!

column3:
そうだわ、聞いてください
オーク達は川向こうのどこかで
恐ろしい魔犬を飼い育てているそうなのです
column4:
Oh, please listen.
It seems that the Orcs are raising a terrifying demon dog somewhere across the river.

column3:
あの黒い霧のような息を吐く
大きな狼をです！
あぁ、何ということでしょう――
column4:
A large wolf that breathes out that black mist!
Oh, what a sight—

column3: そこの方、少し話を聞いてください
column4: Excuse me, could you please spare a moment to listen?

column3:
ドラワンから少し西へ行った岬の方に
教会があるのはご存知でしょうか？
column4: Do you know that there is a church in the direction of the cape a little to the west of Drawan?

column3:
あの教会、実は司祭が魔物に襲われて
廃墟になったという噂なのです
――恐ろしいことです
column4:
That church is actually rumored to have been abandoned after the priest was attacked by demons

--a horrible thing!

column3:
オーク達が棲みついている《ガルドノック砦》
それに近辺に残る遺構のほとんどは
大昔の騎士団のものなのだそうです
column4: The fortress where the orcs dwell, Gardnox Fortress, is said to be mostly comprised of remnants from an ancient knight order.

column3:
北の地には、巨大な橋がかかっているそうです
《フロックヴァルト大橋》という
大変な旧時代の遺構であるとか
column4:
In the northern lands, there is a huge bridge called the "Flocwald Bridge". 
It is said to be a magnificent relic from ancient times of the land.

column3:
しかし、あくまで噂にすぎません
危険を冒して確かめに行くほどの勇気も余力も
持ち合わせておりませんので
column4:
However, it is just a rumor. 
I do not have the courage or resources to go and confirm it at the risk of danger.

column3:
村の少し北、《ガルドノック哨戒地》の
あたりで、おどろくほど大きな足跡が
あったんです
column4: In the area a little north of the village, in the Gardnox Patrol Area, there were surprisingly large footprints on the earth.

column3:
あれは、オークのものなのか
もっと別の魔物のなのか――
column4: Is that an Orc's or some other enemy?

column3:
気にはなりますが、とてもとても
確かめるような勇気も気力もありません
column4: I'm curious, but I don't have the courage or energy to check.

column3:
素材を扱っていますよ
見ていかれますか？
column4:
We deal in materials.
Would you like to take a look?

column3:
植物や鉱石の採取もここでは命がけです
くれぐれも、あなたも警戒を
column4: Collecting plants and ores here is also a matter of life and death. Please be extremely cautious, and observe your surroundings.

column3:
バートランド北部にしか自生していない植物や
発見されていない鉱石もかなりの数があります
column4: There are a considerable number of plants and ores that are native only to the northern part of Betland and have not been discovered until now.

column3:
南へ行けば、もっと高値で取引き
されるのでしょうね
column4: If I go south, I suppose I can make transactions at even higher prices.

column3:
薬草一つが命綱となることもあります
特に、ここドラワンのような環境では
column4: There are times when a single medicinal herb becomes a lifeline. Especially in environments like Drawan.

column3: あぁ？　何か言いてぇことでも？
column4: Yeah?　You got something to say?

column3:
しみったれた村だよなぁ、ったく！
エンポリオやゴートのオッサンくらいしか
飲み相手もいねぇしよ！
column4: What a boring village, seriously! There's no one to drink with except for old geezers like Emporio and Gort!

column3:
キャプテンオーク共の角飾りよ
あれ、あいつらが作りやがったんかな？
売りゃそこそこ金になりそうだよな
column4:
Orc Captain's horns.
I wonder if they made those?
I'm sure they'd make some money selling them.

column3:
遠出するのも面倒臭ぇが、いっぺん
キノザや神殿にゃ行ってみてぇな
column4: It's a hassle to travel, but I'd love to go to Kinoza and the temple once.

column3:
おお、そういやぁよ
砦前のあそこ――なんつったっけ
《千本砦の陣》だっけ？
column4:
Oh, by the way, speaking of it
What was it called over there in front of the fortress?
Was it "The Thousand Bastion Fortress"?

column3:
あそこにオークの隊長格が
部隊をぞろぞろ連れてることがあんだよ
column4: There's an Orc captain over there with a whole troop of them.

column3:
きっとありゃあ、南の砦攻めの準備部隊だぜ
おかげでこの村は無視してくれるがな
column4: There must be a preparation force for the attack on the Southern Fortress. Thanks to that, they're ignoring this village.

column3: 旅の同伴者をお求めでしょうか、覚者殿
column4: Are you looking for a traveling companion, Master Arisen?

column3: 白竜様のご加護があらんことを
column4:
May the blessings of The White Dragon
be with you, Arisen.

column3: リムの輝きは常に貴方と共に
column4: Even now, the Rift's glow shields you.

column3:
メンバーの再編でしたら
私にお申し付けください
column4: If you are reorganizing your membership, please contact me at

column3:
いらっしゃい！
さー、じっくり見てっておくれよ！
column4: Welcome! Now, take your time and have a good look!

column3:
この辺りを探検するなら
そこそこの装備や準備は必要さ！
金を惜しまず命を惜しめってね
column4:
If you're going to explore this area, you'll need to be well equipped and prepared!
Spare no expense, spare no life!

column3:
ゾマは全部が再利用さ！
家も店も井戸も、遺跡をそのまま
使ってるんだ
column4:
Zoma reuses everything!
From houses to shops to wells, they use the ruins as they are.

column3:
ここはザンドラ禁域が開かれて、
モノ好きが集まって急にできた拠点なんだ
ちょっと前から住んでた人もいるみたいだけどね
column4:
Here, the Zandora Wastelands have been opened, and it's become a gathering place for enthusiasts of all things.
There seem to be people who have been living here for a little while now.

column3:
お客さん！　うちに滞在している大剣豪
オリバーさんにはもう会ったかい？
column4: Hey there! Have you met Oliver, the Great Swordsman who is staying with us?

column3:
あの人は《ウォリアー》として有名らしいから
挨拶していくといいよ！
弟子入りの順番待ちもいるそうだよ
column4:
That person seems to be famous as a "Warrior", so it's a good idea to greet them! 
It seems there's also a waiting list for apprenticeship.

column3:
こんにちは
道具類は足りてるかしら？
column4: Hi! Do you have enough tools?

column3:
自分の身は自分で守る
それがここの鉄則よ
何かあっても自分を恨むしかないからね
column4:
Protect your own body.
That is the golden rule here.
If something happens, you will only have yourself to blame, you know.

column3:
私は禁域が開かれる少し前から
ここにいるの
バートランドから禊の神殿の
《湖底連絡路》を通ってね
column4:
I've been here since just before the Forbidden Zone was opened. 
You can reach here from Betland through the 'Lakebottom Connecting Passage' to the Temple of Purification.

column3:
バートランドからオークに追われ
こっちへ移ってきた人は他にもいるわ
column4: I know others who moved here after being chased from Betland by orcs.

column3:
連絡路には恐ろしい魔物もいるし
ここしばらく封鎖されてたようだけど
column4:
There are terrifying enemies in the connecting channel. 
It appears to have been blocked for some time.

column3:
良ければイザベルの話も聞いてやってね
あの子にはよく店を手伝ってもらうの
column4:
If it's alright with you, please also listen to Isabel's story.
She often helps out at the shop.

column3: あら、こんにちは！
column4: Oh, hello!

column3:
あなたも探索者ですか？
上の墓地群や廃墟群はもう行かれました？
私も戦いの心得があったら見学したいです
column4:
Are you also a reward hunter?
Have you already been to the cemetery and ruins up there?
If I had the knowledge of battle, I would like to visit as well.

column3:
私、ここでゾマに集まる物資の保管を
お手伝いしてるんです
《クエストボード》で依頼することも
ありますので、よろしくお願いしますね
column4:
I'm assisting with the storage of supplies gathered by Zoma here. 
I also handle requests through the Quest Board, so if you would be so kind, please feel free to ask. 
Nice to meet you!

column3:
ケイシー姉さんの店にはぜひお立ち寄りを！
道具がないと、いざという時困りますよ
column4:
Please be sure to stop by Casey's shop! 
You'll be in trouble if you don't have any tools when you need them.

column3:
結構結構！
ゆっくり泊ってゆかれるとよいでしょう！
<VAL PRICE_INN>頂きますが
よろしいですな？
column4:
Very well then! 
It would be nice if you could stay and rest leisurely! 
The price for the inn is <VAL PRICE_INN>, is that acceptable to you?

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
《弱化の治療》ですな、もちろん可能ですとも！
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>頂きますが、よろしいですな
column4: Of course, it is possible to receive 'Treat Weakness' for the low price of <VAL PRICE_WEAK>. May I proceed?

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
はてはて、《弱化の治療》は不要のようですな！
ではひと眠りしてお食事でもいかがですかな
column4:
Hm, it seems that 'Treat Weakness' is not necessary!
How about taking a nap and having a meal?

column3:
ようこそ！　ゾマ組合宿は
全ての訪問者を歓迎しますぞ！
column4: Welcome! The Zoma Inn welcomes all visitors.

column3: 少しうんちくを語らせてもらいますぞ
column4: Let me share a little trivia.

column3:
そもそもこのゾマは、かつての大都市メルゴダ
の周辺部にあたる町でしてな

column4:
Hey. 
The debris in the "Odd Rock Valley" that leads to the forbidden zone of Zandora has been removed, making it passable. 
That's good news, but there are creepy enemies lurking along the way.

column3:
どうしてかしら
あの辺りは、そういった魔物が湧きやすい
らしくてね
column4: I wonder why that area is said to be prone to the emergence of such enemies.

column3:
不快だし、ロマンの地には似つかわしくない
魔物だし――
見かけたら掃除しておいてくれないかしら
column4:
It's unpleasant and not suitable for a romantic place.
Because it's an enemy —
Could you please clean it up if you see it?

column3: ザンドラでの冒険、慣れてきたようね
column4: Adventure in Zandora, you seem to be getting used to it, don't you?

column3:
貴方にもっと輝いてもらうために
紹介したい人がいるの
column4: To make you shine even more, There's someone I want to introduce to you.

column3:
《オズワルドの店》に滞在している大剣豪
《ウォリアー》のジョブマスター、オリバーよ
column4: To the esteemed Job Master of the Warrior, Oliver, staying at Oswald's Shop.

column3:
あらゆるものを薙ぎ払い
打ち砕く剛き一撃――
column4: Striking down and crushing everything with a mighty blow—

column3:
きっと貴方なら、その戦い方も
使いこなせると思うわ
column4: I'm sure you'll be able to use that fighting style too!

column3:
――ふふ、弟子入りの順番待ちをしてる
ソーニャには悪いけどね
column4: Hehe, I feel sorry for Sonia, who's waiting her turn to become an apprentice.

column3:
《ウォリアー》として
さらなる輝きを得たければ、会ってみて
column4: If you want to achieve even more brilliance as a Warrior, meet me and see for yourself.

column3:
そうだわ
セラー湖の岸辺にある《禊の神殿　離殿》は
通ったことがあるかしら？
column4:
I see. 
Have you ever been to the Temple of Purification: South Chamber on the shores of Lake Cera?

column3:
あの建物には地下があってね――
《湖底連絡路》という、セラー湖の底を
巡るように繋がれた水路よ
column4: In that building, there is an underground passage, called the "Lakebottom Connecting Passage," which connects the bottom of Lake Cera like a canal.

column3:
あまりに広く、探索にいって迷う人が
多いから封鎖していたのだけれど
もしかしたら変わった魔物や財宝が
眠ってる――かもしれないわね
column4:
Because so many people get lost when they go exploring, we've had it blocked off.
But there might be unique enemies and treasures that are sleeping there— maybe.

column3:
入り口、入れるようにしておくわ
興味があったらご自由にどうぞ――ふふ
column4:
I will make sure to leave the entrance open for you.
Feel free to come in if you're interested―― hehe

column3:
すごい活躍ね
酒場でも貴方の噂をよく耳にするわ
column4:
You're doing great!
I often hear rumors about you at the Tavern.

column3:
ここが活気づいてきたのも
貴方のお陰かしら
column4: Is it thanks to you that this place has become lively?

column3:
支援品に色をつけてあげるわ
これからも頼むわね
column4:
I'll add some color to your support items.
Keep up the good work.

column3:
そうだわ、ちょっと気になることがあってね
貴方の力をあてにさせてもらいたいの
column4: Yes, I'm a little concerned about something and I'd like to count on your help.

column3:
《東ザンドラ廃墟群》――
丘を少し登った遺跡街に
炎を纏ったゴーレムが現れたの
column4: "East Zandora Ruins" - As I approached the ancient city on top of the hill, a Golem clad in flames appeared.

column3:
突然どうして現れたのかしら
誰かが遺跡にあった起動装置を
動かしでもしたのかしら
column4:
I wonder why it suddenly appeared. 
Did someone activate the power device that was in the ruins, perhaps?

column3:
で、そのゴーレムがどうもゾマの方へ
向かうそぶりを見せているらしいのよ
怖いわね――ふふ
column4:
And so, it seems that the Golem is showing signs of heading towards Zoma. 
How scary... hehe

column3:
というわけで、何とかしてくれないかしら
正式なお願いよ
column4:
So please do something about it.
It's a formal request.

column3:
ねぇ、そういえば
この地の北にある《ザンドラ灯台》のことは
知ってる？
column4: Hey, speaking of which, do you know about the Zandora Lighthouse located to the north of this area?

column3:
灯台で、バルバロイの一派が魔獣を
飼いはじめたようなの
column4: It seems like the faction of Barbarians has started keeping magical beasts at the lighthouse.

column3:
噂によれば、トサカと大きな黒い翼を
持つ魔物らしいわ
column4: According to rumors, it seems to be an enemy with a crest and large black wings.

column3:
灯台や廃墟群にいる間はいいけれど
野蛮なバルバロイ達がゾマにきたら厄介だわ
column4: While I'm at the lighthouse or in the ruins, it's fine, but it would be troublesome if those barbarians come to Zoma.

column3:
誰か強い人が――
何とかしてくれないかしら
ねぇ――？
column4:
Is there anyone strong-
Who could do something, I wonder?
Hey-?

column3:
本当に大したものだわ
荒くれ者ばかりのゾマで
貴方ほど探索と戦いの両方に長けた人は
見たことがない
column4:
You're really something, aren't you?
In the rough Zoma where there are only thugs, I have never seen anyone as skilled as you in both exploration and battle.

column3:
貴方と知り合えて、嬉しく思うわ
報酬というのもおこがましいけれど
これからは他の人とは違う、特別な支援を
してあげる――
column4:
I am happy to have met you, although it feels presumptuous to talk about rewards.
From now on, I will provide you with special support that is different from anyone else's.

column3:
私自身も惹かれてしまいそうね
ふふ――
column4:
I myself am also drawn to it, it seems.
Hehe...

column3:
ねぇ――
死者の丘、ゾマの裏手に広がる
高台に《呪詛の庭》と呼ばれる場所があるの
column4:
Hey—
At the back of Zoma, on a hill called the Hill of the Dead, There is a place called the "Garden of Curses."

column3:
人の恨みと死者の魂を吸い
得体の知れぬ"実"をぶらさげた木々が
茂る、《虚ろの祠》に接した庭よ
column4:
In the garden that adjoins the "Shrine of Emptiness",
Trees hung with mysterious "seeds" that absorb the grudges of people and the souls of the deceased flourish.

column3:
そこでね、先日祠に盗掘にいった人達が
皆殺しにされたの
column4: So you know, the people who went to desecrate the shrine the other day were all killed.

column3:
何が彼らの命を奪ったのかしらね――
気になると思わない？
column4:
I wonder what took their lives--
Don't you think it's curious?

column3:
そろそろあなたに
きちんと依頼を出してみようかしら
column4: Perhaps it's about time I properly request something from you.

column3:
私が頼みたいのは
死者の丘、最大の謎――
"亡霊騎士と呪いの秘宝"の解明なの
column4:
I'm asking you to help me solve the greatest mystery of the Hill of the Dead--
"The Ghost Knight and the Cursed Treasure".

column3:
その秘宝があると言われているのは
ザンドラ礼拝堂の地下に広がる
《死王の迷宮》よ
column4: It is said that the secret treasure is located in the underground of Zandora Chapel, spread out in the Dead Lord's Labyrinth.

column3:
――私はその奥に何があるのか
知りたいの
column4: --I want to know what's behind it

column3:
そのためだけに
ここで貴方のような人を待ちながら
エリアマスターをしてきたのかも――
column4: Perhaps, it was for the sake of waiting for someone like you here that I became an Area Master.

column3:
でも、あそこは冗談抜きで危険な場所
挑むかどうかは貴方に委ねるわ
column4:
But that's a dangerous place, no joke.
I'll leave it up to you to decide if you want to take on the challenge.

column3:
本当に大したものだわ
荒くれ者ばかりのゾマで、貴方ほど
探索と戦いの両方に長けた人は見たことがない
column4:
You're really something, aren't you?
In the rough Zoma where there are only thugs, I have never seen anyone as skilled as you in both exploration and battle.

column3:
貴方と知り合えて、嬉しく思うわ
報酬というのもおこがましいけれど
これを持って行って
column4:
I am happy to have met you, although it feels presumptuous to talk about rewards. 
From now on, I will provide you with special support that is different from anyone else's.

column3:
――ん、私自身も惹かれてしまいそう
ふふ――
column4:
I myself am also drawn to it, it seems.
Hehe...

column3:
すごい活躍だそうね
酒場でも貴方の噂をよく耳にするわ
column4: I often hear rumors about your great achievements. Your fame reaches even the Tavern.

column3:
ここが活気づいてきたのも貴方のお陰かしら
はい、このところの働きへの贈り物よ
また頼むわね
column4:
Is it thanks to you that this place has become lively, I wonder? 
Yes, this is a gift for your recent work. 
I will rely on you again.

column3:
諸々のご協力感謝するわ
はい、これを受け取って
ゾマを代表して私から、あなたへの贈り物よ
column4:
Thanks for all your help.
Yes, take this.
My gift to you on behalf of Zoma.

column3:
――逞しい人って、素敵
いつも良くしてくれるあなたには
これを進呈するわ
column4:
A reliable person is wonderful, isn't it? 
For always treating me well, I offer this to you.

column3:
あなたにだけ特別よ――
他の連中には内緒ね
column4: This is just for you— It's a secret from the others.

column3: いつでも待っているわ、ふふ――
column4: Any time, I'll be waiting, hehe...

column3:
はい、今回の支援品よ
貴方には粗品じゃ物足りないだろうと思って
少しグレードを上げてみたわ
column4:
Yes, this time's support goods.
I thought regular goods wouldn't be enough for you, so I upgraded them a bit.

column3: 役に立てて頂戴
column4: Please make use of it.

column3:
ちょうど今日は、探索者の支援日なの
これ、差し入れよ、使ってちょうだい
column4: Today is the day of support for adventurers. Here, please take this as a treat and use it.

column3:
ゾマにようこそ
何か相談事かしら
column4:
Welcome to Zoma.
Is there something you wish to discuss?

column3:
ふふ――
私はここに集う人達を見るのが好き
column4:
Hehe...
I like seeing the people gathered here.

column3:
野望とか夢とか、ロマンとか力試しとか
そんな漠然としたモノに酔ってる人達って
可愛いと思わない？
column4: Don't you think people who are intoxicated by such vague things like ambition, dreams, romance, and tests of strength are adorable?

column3:
チャンスの一欠片を、少しでも多くの人に
伝えてあげたいの
ここには、そういう話が集まるから
column4:
I want to convey a fragment of a chance to as many people as possible.
Because stories like that gather here.

column3:
ゾマにはもっと華やかに、より危険に
なってもらいたいわ
そして、ぎらぎらした人を呼び込むの
column4:
I want Zoma to become more glamorous and dangerous.
And thus, attract dazzling people.

column3:
そういう人の中から、失われた黄金郷へ
真に辿りつける人が出るかもしれないから
column4: Because among such people, there might be someone who can truly reach the lost golden paradise.

column3: そして、深い迷宮の奥にもね――
column4: And thus, even in the depths of a profound labyrinth...

column3:
《辺境の礎》ってあるわよね
この辺りにあるソレが全て使えるようになったそうよ
ついさっき、神殿からの使いがそう言っていたわ
column4:
There's a "Sub Portcrystal".
 It seems like everything around here can be used now. 
Just a moment ago, a messenger from the temple said so.

column3:
不便だったところへも一瞬で移動できる
優れものだと聞いたけど――
何だか無粋だわ
column4:
I've heard it's great to get to places that were inconvenient in an instant, but--
it's kind of tacky.

column3:
私はね、ザンドラ東部に来たのなら自分の足で
移動してほしいと思ってるのよ
この荒れ地に転がる数々のロマンの欠片を
見落としてほしくないもの――
column4:
You know, if you've come to Eastern Zandora, I'd like you to move on your own. 
I don't want you to miss the scattered fragments of romance that lie in this wild land—

column3:
ねぇ――最近、ここから東の方で
大きな鎧が暴れているらしいのよ――
column4: Hey... Lately, it seems like there's a big armor causing trouble somewhere east from here...

column3:
きっと何らかの魔力で操られた鎧が
あの場所に染みついた死臭に導かれて
やって来たのね
column4:
The armor, 
likely manipulated by some kind of magic, 
has come to that place guided by the stench 
of death that permeates it.

column3:
ふふ、この辺りでは珍しいことじゃないわ――
特にあそこは人獣問わず死体が多くて
《屍のすすり泣く地》なんて呼ばれているんですもの
column4:
Hehe, not unusual around here...
That area gathers corpses of human
and beast alike - known as the
"Weeping Corpse Ground."

column3:
だけど、鎧のうろつく範囲が
段々拡がってきているらしいのが気がかりなの
このゾマにまでやってきたら――
column4:
But I'm concerned that the range of armor wandering around seems to be getting wider and wider.
If it gets to this Zoma...

column3:
探求者たちを支える町が潰えては、大変
頼もしい誰かが討伐に行ってくれないかしら――
ねぇ？
column4:
If the town that supports the adventurers collapses, it will be a disaster.
I wonder if someone reliable could go and subdue it, I wonder...
Hey?

column3:
そうね、《幽玄の霊堂》のことはもう知っていて？
どんな場所かって？
カタコンベ――そう、地下墓地よ
column4:
So then, do you already know about the Mysterious Mausoleum?
What kind of place is it?
Catacombs――yes, an underground graveyard.

column3:
元は歴史ある霊堂だったそうよ
けど、今は眠りにつくことができない死者たちが
彷徨い続けているんだとか――
column4:
Originally, it was a historic mausoleum, they say.
But now, it seems that the deceased who cannot find rest continue to wander.

column3:
死者たちは本当に眠りにつくことが
できなかったのかしら？
それとも故郷であるザンドラがこんなことになって
無念さのあまり眠りから覚めてしまったのかしら――
column4: I wonder if the deceased were truly unable to rest in peace, or if their homeland, Zandora, becoming like this caused them to awaken from their slumber out of overwhelming regret.

column3:
そういえば
あの人たちまだ帰ってこないのよね――
column4: Speaking of which, that guy hasn't come back yet--

column3:
ふふ、この前《幽玄の霊堂》に
意気揚々と盗掘に行った若者のことよ
column4: Hmmm, I'm talking about the young man who went to the other day to steal from the Mysterious Mausoleum.

column3:
まだ若い子たちだったんだけど
若さ故の無謀さで
死者の仲間入りをしちゃったのかしら
column4: They were still young, but in their youthful recklessness, I wonder if they joined the dead.

column3:
あら、貴方――
気になるって顔してるわね
よっぽど人が良いのかしら？
column4:
Oh, you... 
You have such an interested look on your face. 
I wonder if you're a really kind person?

column3:
いいわ、もし様子を見に行きたいなら
私に相談して
column4: If you wish to go and see for yourself, please consult with me.

column3:
今や貴方はこのゾマで
一番の探索者、そして戦士よ
貴方のような存在そのものがロマンと言っても
いいんじゃないかしら
column4:
Now, you are the greatest explorer and warrior in this Zoma. 
It might even be right to call an existence like you 'romance'.

column3:
貴方と知り合えて、嬉しく思うわ
支援品をうんと格上のものにするから
また話を聞かせてちょうだい
column4:
I am glad to have met you.
I will upgrade the support goods even more, So please let me hear your story again.

column3:
――ん、私ったら貴方に惹かれてるのかしら
ふふ――
column4: Hmm, I wonder if I'm attracted to you. Hehe...

column3: 何だァ？　用があるならさっさと言いな
column4: What is it?　If you have something to say, just say it.

column3:
俺はな、ダイアンの野郎とは違うんだよ！
レッキとした正規の騎士様なんだぞ、おう！
column4: I'm different from that guy Dion, you know! I'm a proper knight, yeah!

column3:
まーったく、こんな辺境に派遣されるとは
ついてねェぜ
column4: I can't believe I was dispatched to such a remote place. This is just my luck.

column3:
どんなとこでも行ってやらァ、任せとけ
とは言ったがよ
酒の席のセリフを真に受けるかよフツウ！
あァッ！？
column4:
I'll go anywhere and do it, leave it to me! 
That's what I said, but seriously, who takes lines from a drinking party seriously? Seriously!?

column3:
別に騎士団が守んなくてもよォ
ここの連中はそれなりにどいつも
やってってるよ！
そう思わねぇか？
column4:
It's not like the knight order needs to protect anyone. 
These guys, in their own way, are all doing their best! Don't you think so?

column3: 旅の同伴者をお求めですか？　覚者様
column4: Are you looking for a travel companion, Ser Arisen?

column3: 白竜様のご加護があらんことを
column4:
May the blessings of The White Dragon
be with you, Arisen.

column3: リムの輝きは常に貴方と共に
column4: Even now, the Rift's glow shields you.

column3:
メンバーの再編をお考えでしたら
なんなりと
column4:
If you are thinking of reorganizing your 
party members, please do not hesitate 
to ask.

column3:
ゾマは、いつも死と隣合わせ
村の上一帯は"死者の丘"と呼ばれているの
column4:
Zoma always flirts with death. 
The entire upper area of the village is called the "Hill of the Dead."

column3:
瘴気っていうの？　よく解らないけれど
それが強いらしくって、昼だろうが雨だろうが
おかまいなしに、不死者が外をうろついてるわ
column4:
Is it called miasma? 
I don't really understand, but It seems to be strong, whether it's daytime or raining.
Regardless, the undead roam outside, uncaring.

column3:
彼らのようになりたくなければ
十分休養して英気を養ってゆくことね
column4: If you don't want to end up like them, you'd better get plenty of rest and get your strength back!

column3:
この辺りの事について詳しく知りたければ
ナディアに相談してみればいいわ
column4: If you want to know more about this area, you should consult Nadia.

column3:
でも彼女、あれでなかなか苦労も多いのよ
力になってあげてね、お強い覚者様
column4:
But she has faced many hardships with that, you know. 
Please support her, you strong Arisen.

column3:
ここでアタシの歌を聴いてくれたお客さん
遺跡や墓地を荒らしに行って
そのまま戻らない人も多いわ
column4: Many of the guests who have heard me sing here go to vandalize ruins and cemeteries and never come back.

column3:
野盗をしてるか、別の村へ行ったのか
それとも不死者になったのか――
column4:
Did he become a bandit, or did he go to another village?
Or maybe he became an undead--

column3: アナタはまた戻っていらしてね？
column4: Will you come back again?

column3: 一曲いかがかしら？
column4: How about a song?

column3:
おお、必要な品があれば
分けてやるぞ
column4: Oh, if there is anything you need, I will gladly share it with you.

column3:
砦の資材集めもなかなか馬鹿にならん
討伐任務もすぐに新しいのが来るしなぁ
column4:
Gathering materials for the fortress is no easy task, I tell you. 
And the subjugation missions keep coming one after another.

column3:
お前もできればグリッテン砦の
《クエストボード》案件、手伝ってくれよ
column4: If you can, please help me with the quest on the Quest Board of Fort Gritten.

column3:
バートランド平原に行けるように
なってたらな
column4: If I were able to go to the Betland Plains, that would be great.

column3:
オークどもめ、こないだの砦攻めで
盛大にあちこち壊しやがって
column4: Those orcs, during the fortress assault the other day, made a mess breaking things everywhere.

column3:
ここが破られたらいよいよ奴らの思い通りだ
ま、俺たちがそうはさせないがな
column4: If this place is destroyed, they'll finally have their way. Well, we won't let that happen, though.

column3: なんだ、用があるなら手短にな
column4: If you have any business, please make it brief.

column3:
休んでいくか？　ま、体調管理も任務のうちだ
<VAL PRICE_INN>は利用代として徴収するがな
column4: Are you going to take a break? Well, managing your health is part of your duties. <VAL PRICE_INN> will be collected as a fee.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
休むなら、そこのベッドを自由に使え
お前は期待の新人だ
体は大事にしてもらわんとな
column4:
If you want to rest, feel free to use that bed there.
You're the new guy we're counting on.
You've got to take care of yourself.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
ああ、《弱化の治療》だな？
悪いが<VAL PRICE_WEAK>、徴収するぞ
column4:
Ah, is it "Treat Weakness"?
I'm sorry, but it's <VAL PRICE_WEAK>. 
I have to collect it.

column3: はい
column4: Yes

column3: いいえ
column4: No

column3:
うん？　お前は《弱化》に掛ってはいないぞ
しっかりしろよ
column4:
Huh? You aren't weakened, are you?
Pull yourself together.

column3:
覚者にも、ポーンの民と契約を
結べる者と結べない者がいる
column4: Even among the Arisen, there are those who can form contracts with Pawns, and those who cannot.

column3:
俺は後者だったが――
いったい何が違うというんだ、くそ！
column4:
I was the latter, but--
What exactly is the difference, damn it!

column3:
剣の技を学びたければ
ヴァネッサ副隊長に認めてもらう他ない
せいぜい修練することだ
column4:
If you want to learn sword techniques, there is no choice but to gain recognition from Captain Vanessa, the vice captain. 
All you can do is train diligently.

column3:
「この砦を持たせることが、俺達の任務」
そんな事を言うやつがいるが
お前もそのクチか？
column4:
There are those who say, 'Our mission is to hold this fortress.' 
Are you also one of them?

column3: 守ってるだけで勝てはしないだろうに
column4: Just protecting won't lead to victory, will it?

column3: よぉ！　御同輩
column4: Hello! My comrade.

column3:
ハイデル平原の北、
砦裏の《バートランド平原》は
まだオーク共の影響下だ
column4:
To the north of the Hidell Plains, past the fortress, lies the Betland Plains. 
It is still under the influence of the Orcs.

column3:
危険が大きいからなぁ
かなりの武功、もしくは任務でもなけりゃ
裏へ抜けることはできねぇぜ
column4:
Because the danger is significant, you see.
Unless it's an impressive achievement or a vital mission, you can't make your way to the back.

column3:
まぁ、《ダウ渓谷》のエリアマスター
ヘイデンに認められりゃ、
ダウ渓谷側の関所からあっちの方へ
抜けられるらしいがな
column4: Well, if you're recognized by Hayden, the Area Master of Dowe Valley, it seems you can pass through the checkpoint on the Dowe Valley side and head over to the other side.

column3:
オーク野郎どもは、今日も休みらしいぜ
来たらぶった斬ってやるのによ
column4:
Those orc bastards seem to be taking a day off today. 
If they come, I'll cut them down.

column3: ヴァネッサ副隊長に挨拶くらいしてけよな
column4: Make sure to greet Vice Captain Vanessa, okay?

column3:
ハハハ！
騎士団の腰ぬけにゃ、まぁこの砦は
守れんだろうさ
column4: Hahaha! With those spineless knights, I doubt this fortress can be defended.

column3: なんだ？　連絡事項でもあるのか？
column4: What is it?　You have a message for me?

column3:
《バートランド平原》側への
通行が許可されたんだな
任務、頑張れよ！
column4:
So, I see you've been granted permission to travel to the Betland Plains. 
Good luck with your mission!

column3:
前の戦闘を皮切りに、奴らもこちらへ
攻撃をしかけることが増えてきた
つどつど追い返すしかないのが辛いところだな
column4:
Starting with the previous fight, they have been increasing their attacks towards us. 
It's tough having to constantly push them back.

column3: 元を断てればいいんだが――
column4: If only we could cut off the source--

column3:
この正面門の通行には、統率の許可が必要だ
砦の向こう、《バートランド平原》は
完全な危険地帯だからな
column4:
Permission from your superiors is required to pass through this main gate. 
Beyond the fortress lies the Betland Plains, a highly dangerous area.

column3:
よほどの任務か理由でもなければ
おいそれとは通れないさ
column4:
Unless it's a significant mission or reason,
You can't just pass through casually.

column3:
北部のバートランド平原は
オーク共の根城に近い
このグリッテン砦が、奴らの侵攻を塞ぐ要なのさ
column4:
The Betland Plains in the north is close to the stronghold of the orcs.
Fort Gritten is vital in fending off their invasion.

column3:
北部の魔物どもは手強い上に数も多い
ハイデルに奴らを通すわけにはいかないのだ
column4:
The northern enemies are not only formidable, but their numbers are also high.
We cannot let them through to Hidell.

column3: やぁ、お疲れさん
column4: Hey, you must be tired.

column3:
バートランド平原には
いくつか要注意ポイントがあるんだ
column4: There are several points of interest in the Bertrand Plain:

column3:
まずはセラー湖近くの《湖岸の廃墟》
大型の魔物がなぜか現れやすいんだ
column4:
First, the "Lakeside Ruins" near Lake Cera.
Large enemies tend to appear for some reason.

column3:
あとは、平原西はずれの《バートランド大橋》だね
こっちはよほどの偵察でもなけりゃ
行かないだろうけど
オークの部隊が巡回していることがあるんだ
column4:
Next, there's the Betland Bridge on the western edge of the plain, right?
Unless you're on a serious reconnaissance mission, you probably won't go there, but there are times when Orc units patrol the area.

column3:
湖の浜辺あたりも
水棲竜の目撃情報があったりして物騒だよね
まぁ、結局どこもわりと危険なんだけど
column4:
Even the beach around the lake has reports of sightings of aquatic dragons, making it dangerous.
Well, in the end, everywhere is relatively dangerous.

column3:
とほほ、ブーツの紐が切れちゃったよ
縁起悪いよなぁ
column4:
And ohoho, my boot laces broke.
That's not a good omen, is it?

column3: オークの臭いがもうちょっとマシだったらなぁ
column4: If only the smell of the Orc was a little less repugnant...

column3:
まぁでも、そんな愚痴を言ってられるのも
生きてるからだよなぁ
column4: Well, but I'm only able to complain about that because I'm alive.

column3:
知ってるか？　ヴァネッサ副隊長も
前は色々大変だったそうだ
column4: Did you know? Vice Captain Vanessa also went through a lot before.

column3:
女で覚者で、騎士団からの風当たりも
強かったりでな
column4: As a woman and an Arisen, the criticism from the Knight's Order can be strong.

column3:
ま、だからこそあんな凛々しくカッコよく
へへへ――
なれたんだろうなぁ
column4:
Well, that's why she was able to become so noble and cool.
Hehehe--

column3:
いやー、参った参った
まさかお前がここまで凄いとはなぁ――
副隊長がベタ褒めするのもしょうがないか
column4:
Well, I'm impressed, I'm impressed. 
I didn't expect you to be this amazing. 
I guess even the vice-captain's over-the-top praise is understandable.

column3:
正直、お前がいなかったらこの砦は
オークに落とされてたかもしれん
俺も他のヤツも、それは解ってるツモリさ
column4:
Honestly, if you weren't here, this fortress might have been taken down by Orcs. 
Both me and the others know that.

column3:
さ、今度の特別報償だ
胸を張って受け取れよ！
column4: Well, this time it's a special reward, so accept it with pride!

column3:
よぉよぉ！！　ブイブイ言わせてる
みたいじゃないか
新入りだと思ってたらあっという間だな
column4:
Hey, hey! 
You're really making waves, aren't you? 
I thought you were a newcomer, but time flies.

column3:
お前の働きに対して、報償が出たぞ
ま、それだけ戦果をあげたってわけだ
誇っていいぞ、うん
column4:
You've been rewarded for your work.
Well, that's what you get for fighting the good fight.
You should be proud, yeah.
